dt: {bc}assured with a guarantee {dx_def}see {dxt|guarantee:2||3}{/dx_def} {bc}protected or promised by a guarantee

dt.t: In some California locales … public-safety workers can pull down truly swank livings, given their salaries, health benefits and {wi}guaranteed{/wi} pension payouts.

dt: {bc}certain to have a specified result or effect

dt.t: … the structural imbalance between rich cities and poor countrysides produces economic relations {wi}guaranteed{/wi} to bring out the worst in people.
She transforms the discussion of ideas into a gratuitous spectacle of anger and aggression {wi}guaranteed{/wi} to elevate the Nielsen ratings …

shortdef: assured with a guarantee : protected or promised by a guarantee
certain to have a specified result or effect

dt: {bc}to undertake to answer for the debt, default, or {d_link|miscarriage|miscarriage} of
{bc}to engage for the existence, permanence, or nature of {bc}undertake to do or secure

quotes.t: Voucher plans were adopted largely as a last resort, an effort to {qword}guarantee{/qword} a semblance of school choice for low-income minority students in failing inner-city schools.
They're called change agents. They swoop in to transform stodgy institutions …  . It's a risky tack, one that {qword}guarantees{/qword} large numbers of people will hate the boss's guts.
For an incumbent President …  . The power of the office and the media coverage its holder is {qword}guaranteed{/qword} for just doing his job generally give him the luxury of staying above the fray.

shortdef: to undertake to answer for the debt, default, or miscarriage of
to engage for the existence, permanence, or nature of : undertake to do or secure
